task.summary: Default task

Improve UI layout and introduce search functionality in SimpleLauncher
Updated the MainWindow UI layout to optimize space and improve readability. Removed old grid definitions and applied new structure to better accommodate components. In addition, introduced a search function to filter files based on user's query. A 'Please Wait" window is displayed while the search is executing for improved user experience.

Add search feature and improve interface
Implemented a feature where search can be triggered by pressing 'Enter' in MainWindow. This includes the display of warning messages when a system is not selected or a search query is missing. Also, the display messages have been updated to cater to scenarios when there are no files or no games for a particular query. Enhanced the 'Please Wait' window to include a border and a new gif image, along with the removal of the window from the taskbar. Finally, the class inheritance hierarchy of 'PleaseWaitWindow' was simplified.

Update AssemblyVersion and FileVersion, remove XamlAnimatedGif package
The AssemblyVersion and FileVersion have been updated from 2.10.0.10 to 2.11.0.5 reflecting the recent changes in the application. The 'XamlAnimatedGif' package reference has been removed from the project as it is no longer necessary.

Add multiple new machines to mame.xml
This update includes new machines and improved descriptions for existing ones in the mame.xml file. The machines span various categories and countries, broadening the range of gaming options users can choose from. The descriptions are revised for better clarity and precision.

Implement game visibility settings
Refactored the game visibility option from a boolean flag to a series of menu items to provide users with more options. Users can now choose to display all games, only games with covers, or only games without covers. Also adjusted references to the ExtractCompressedFile singleton instance.

Refactor variable and class instances naming in project files
The commit involves multiple updates centered on variables and class instances renaming across different project files. The variable `SystemIsMAME` was renamed to `SystemIsMame` to maintain consistent camel casing. Similarly, class instance naming was refactored, especially for `GamePadController` and `ExtractCompressedFile` to make them more clear and accurate. This commit also includes removing some unnecessary portions of code for optimization purposes.

Refactor error logging to improve performance
Optimized the error logging process by removing unnecessary locking and improving the usage of async methods. Code has been refactored to first write error logs to both general and user-specific files and then attempt to send these logs to the API. If successful, the general log file is deleted.

Update SimpleLauncher version to 2.11.1.15
The AssemblyVersion and FileVersion for the SimpleLauncher project have been incremented. The changes are reflected in the SimpleLauncher.csproj file.

Refactor GameButtonFactory and MainWindow, add new SystemConfig
GameButtonFactory has been refactored to improve image loading process by handling corrupted images with a fallback. In MainWindow.xaml.cs, redundant comments and dead code have been trimmed, improving readability. Additionally, support for game search functionality is now provided. The system.xml file was updated to include a new SystemConfig.

Improve search functionality and pagination reset
The search box now clears when a different system is selected, enhancing the app's usability. Additionally, the pagination reset action has been moved to trigger at the start of the LoadGameFiles function. This change allows for better reliability and consistency in user interactions, as the search function no longer handles the pagination reset.

Refactor code in SimpleLauncher for pagination and visibility settings
The code in SimpleLauncher for pagination has been refined to ensure better clarity and efficiency. The function to reset pagination buttons has been consolidated and is now called in a more centralized manner. Additionally, a new function ApplyShowGamesSetting() has been introduced to manage the settings for game visibility based on the ShowGames configuration. Redundant code related to EmulatorComboBox_SelectionChanged event handler and Scroller.ScrollToTop() has been removed.

Update assembly version and improve comment clarity
This commit includes a change in the assembly and file version of SimpleLauncher. It updates from 2.11.1.15 to 2.11.2.23. Also, the code comment in MainWindow.xaml.cs is updated to more accurately describe the behavior of the method ApplyShowGamesSetting().

Add ClassDiagram for SimpleLauncher
A new ClassDiagram.cd file has been created to represent the structure of the SimpleLauncher project. This diagram includes all the classes involved in the project, their respective positions and their type identifiers. The diagram aims to provide a visual understanding of the architecture of the SimpleLauncher application.

Update SettingsConfig and SystemConfig, add CheckEmulator and CheckSystem
Removed unused 'HideGamesWithNoCover' settings field. ThumbnailSize default value altered to 200 and InfoUrl updated. Properties in SystemConfig are updated to use 'set' instead of 'init'. Robust error handling and recovery strategy added to reading XML configuration. Two new classes, CheckEmulator and CheckSystem, have been added without any implementation.

Implement system configuration validation and enhance display
The code has been updated to improve the display of system and game information by dynamically creating TextBlocks for each emulator. Additionally, a system configuration validation feature was added that checks the existence of files and folders. This improves the reliability of the program and provides better user feedback on configuration issues.
WIP

Refactor code and improve system and emulator validation
Updated the system and emulator validation logic in the SimpleLauncher project, making it more accurate and efficient. Console output messages in LoadFiles.cs were also commented out for clearer execution. Additionally, the LoadGamesAsync method was disabled and unused files, CheckEmulator.cs and CheckSystem.cs, were removed from the project. The DisplaySystemInfo method in MainWindow.xaml.cs was also updated to display more detailed system configuration and validation errors.

Refactor path validation in EditSystem.xaml.cs
Updated the IsValidPath function in EditSystem.xaml.cs to streamline the code and enhance handling of relative paths. It directly checks for existing absolute paths, and it also correctly combines base directories with relative paths that go up from the base directory.

Add system_model.xml and update error message in LogErrors.cs
Implemented a new system_model.xml file containing system configuration for various retro game systems. Also, modified the error message formatting in LogErrors.cs to improve readability and clarity. This commit intends to enhance overall system capabilities and user experience.

Improve error message formatting and detail
This commit refines the formatting for more streamlined error messages and increases the details provided when an error occurs. The detailed error message now includes instructions for the user to visit the Simple Launcher Wiki on Github for a list of parameters for each emulator.

Update AssemblyVersion and FileVersion to 2.12.0
The AssemblyVersion and FileVersion in the SimpleLauncher.csproj file have been updated from 2.11.2.23 to 2.12.0. This update indicates the new version of the SimpleLauncher application.

Refactor error handling and logging in GameLauncher
This commit streamlines error handling and logging in the GameLauncher.cs file. Instead of presenting error messages directly, it introduces intermediate strings for error messages. This makes it easier for the logging operation and provides a cleaner code structure. Additionally, the commit improves readability by rephrasing the error messages.

Simplify error message creation in GameLauncher
This commit combines two lines into one when creating a game launching error message. The error message now reports the problem, exit code, emulator, and parameters in a single concatenated string, streamlining error reporting for better readability and efficiency.

Refactor error logging in GameLauncher
A new Exception object has been introduced to store the error message in GameLauncher.cs. This small tweak improves code readability and clarity by giving a clear definition to the Exception before it's passed to the LogErrorAsync method. It maintains the same functionality as before.

Refactor error logging in GameLauncher
The exception handling in GameLauncher.cs has been streamlined. The variable 'logException' has been renamed to 'exception' for greater clarity. Additionally, the error message is now passed directly to the 'LogErrorAsync' method to improve error logging efficiency.

Refactor error logging in GameLauncher
The update refactors the way we log errors in the GameLauncher class. Previously, we directly passed a new Exception object into the LogErrorAsync method. Now, we first create an Exception object with the error message and then pass it and the error message separately into the method, allowing for more granular error logging and management.

Update alert and error system with enhanced messaging
The commit improves user interaction by updating message box pop-ups in various areas of SimpleLauncher. It added the MessageBoxImage parameter in all MessageBox usage for a more intuitive symbol indication per message type (Warning, Info, Error, etc). Error handling has also been improved with error messages and logging incorporated in the application. Further, the Cleanup method now logs if it encounters errors while deleting temp directories.

Update error handling and cleanup code
The code has been updated to improve error handling across various files. The changes primarily include logging errors asynchronously, showing explicit error dialogs to the user, and better handling of exceptions. Additionally, redundant or commented-out pieces of code have been removed to make the program more readable and maintainable.

Refactor error logging and alter UI updates
The changes in this commit mainly deal with how errors are logged throughout different modules of the application, replacing async calls with a new approach that uses Tasks and waiting. It also modifies some UI updates, such as the way error messages are displayed and version details are assigned. Moreover, unnecessary white spaces are removed and some methods are refactored to synchronous.

Update emulator location validation
Added an additional check to ensure the emulator location path is provided before validating it. This change aims to prevent errors when an emulator's location path is not specified in the SimpleLauncher application.

Update search and reset functions in MainWindow.xaml.cs
Improved the search and reset functionalities within the MainWindow.xaml.cs file. Added clarity and functionality to the search process by ensuring the SearchTextBox is cleared and any selected letters are deselected when either function is invoked. Also removed commented out error-handling code, making the code cleaner and easier to read.

Refactor error handling and improve UI interactions
This commit enhances error messages and User Interface (UI) interactions across several classes. Message error text has been streamlined, and exception handling improved across various methods and classes for better error logging and user notification. The code in UI classes has been updated for enhanced user experience: particularly in MainWindow, EditSystem, and GameButtonFactory. Certain redundant comments and checks have also been removed for cleaner, more maintainable code.

Update error handling and messaging
The error handling workflow has been updated to offer more self-explanatory advisory messages to users. This includes enhanced information about issues with loading or parsing of settings.xml, handling of the missing system.xml, and opening of the update link. Automated creation of system.xml has been removed, and users are now prompted to restart or reinstall the application when this file is missing.

Update SimpleLauncher assembly version to 2.12.1
The assembly and file version of SimpleLauncher has been updated from 2.12.0 to 2.12.1. This update reflects the incremental changes made to the software.

Refactor code to improve error handling and game button creation
This commit introduces better error handling for file loading operations such as the system.xml and mame.xml. If these files are missing or corrupted, the application now shuts down, advising the user to reinstall the software. In addition, the game button creation was optimized to prioritize the machine's description as the search term, if it exists, for the YouTube video and info link functionalities. The system's edit page now creates an image folder for new systems, if not specified by the user.

Remove irrelevant screenshots, update emulator parameters
Two screenshots have been removed from the `SimpleLauncher.sln` and `README.md` to declutter the visual presentation. Also, the MAME system parameters within `parameters.md` have been updated to provide clearer instructions, including a concrete parameter example for better understanding.

Update system configurations and clean up parameters documentation
Improved emulator settings in the system_model.xml and removed redundant "system.xml" from SimpleLauncher.csproj. Also, reframed the parameters.md file for an easier reading experience by eliminating unnecessary spacing and excluding non-essential emulator configurations.

Add emulator parameters validation and stats API call
Implemented validation for emulator parameters in EditSystem.xaml.cs, which ensures all paths provided in the parameters are valid. Made use of the System.Text.RegularExpressions namespace for this. Additionally, implemented an asynchronous API call to a stats page in MainWindow.xaml.cs during loading, and created a new Stats.cs file to handle this logic.

Add validation for emulator parameters
Added validation checks to ensure parameters for the five emulators are valid or empty. This is performed before saving emulator configuration to prevent incorrect input data from being stored. The relevant fields are also marked as invalid if they don't pass the validation checks.

Implement validation for relative paths in parameters
A new check is introduced to ensure the validity of paths specified within emulator parameters. This enhancement converts any relative paths to absolute using the application's current directory as base. Additional error messages have also been included to inform users about invalid path entries in emulator parameters.

Add API key to HTTP request header
An API key was added to the default request headers of the HttpClient object in Stats.cs. This was done to authorize the communication with the endpoint "https://purelogiccode.com/simplelauncher/stats.php". Also, some ineffective lines of code were removed for better readability.

Add appsettings.sample.json and update .gitignore
A sample json file for application settings (appsettings.sample.json) has been added. The .gitignore file has also been updated to ignore actual application settings (appsettings.json) to prevent sensitive API keys from being committed.

Add Newtonsoft.Json package and update launcher guidance and bug report
Implemented Newtonsoft.Json package to SimpleLauncher.csproj for handling configuration files. Updated the 'parameters.md' file to include instructions for testing batch files outside the Simple Launcher. Modified 'BugReport.xaml.cs' to load an API key from a configuration file, "appsettings.json", instead of using a hardcoded value; it also handles missing or unconfigured API keys appropriately.

Implement dynamic API key configuration
Enhance security by allowing rotation of API keys without requiring code changes.

Refactor code to better handle null references
This commit updates several files to better handle potential null references. The changes focus on replacing direct calls or assignments that could result in null reference exceptions with null-conditional operators or explicit null checks. Additionally, some safeguards have been introduced where necessary to ensure the parsed or converted values are valid and expected. These changes enhance the robustness and reliability of the code.

Added example emulator locations and improved documentation notes
Detailed example emulator locations have been provided for easier setup. Documentation notes related to cores which may require bios files or special configurations have been expanded to encourage the user to read the core documentation.

Update emulator information in documentation
The changes primarily include updating emulator parameters, adding emulator path examples, and adjusting readability. The updates enhance the clarity of emulator configurations and usage guidelines, with an emphasis on providing complete information for users to read and understand.

Refactor string handling and improve code clarity
These changes include refactoring how ApiKey is retrieved from the config and amending some code comments for improved clarity. String handling has been adjusted in the UpdateChecker class to cater for unexpected null values in the versionTag. Some unnecessary comments have been removed and grammatical changes have been made to others across various files. Changes also include safer and more accurate conversions from relative to absolute paths in EditSystem file.
Sorry, it seems like you forgot to provide the code differences (diffs). Please provide them so I can generate a suitable commit message.

Update target framework and version in SimpleLauncher project
Updated the project file to target a more general .NET framework (net8.0-windows) for better compatibility. Also increased the AssemblyVersion and FileVersion to 2.13.0, following semantic versioning.

MESSAGE.value:

Update system configurations and clean up parameters documentation
Updated the system_model.xml to change system folders, add more emulator configurations and adjust settings for some existing ones. Simultaneously, removed the "system.xml" from the SimpleLauncher project. The parameters.md documentation file was also significantly cleaned up for better readability by removing unnecessary space and out-focused emulator configurations.

Update system configurations and clean up parameters documentation
Improved emulator settings in the system_model.xml and removed redundant "system.xml" from SimpleLauncher.csproj. Also, reframed the parameters.md file for an easier reading experience by eliminating unnecessary spacing and excluding non-essential emulator configurations.

Additionally, implemented an asynchronous API call to a stats page in MainWindow.xaml.cs during loading, and created a new Stats.cs file to handle this logic.
